page.title: 02MOTTISFONT ABBEY
page.content: MOTTISFONT ABBEY An Augustinian Priory dating back to 1170, given by Henry VIII to his Lord Chancellor, William Sandys, and converted into a house. Now owned by the National Trust. Only the Whistler room, in trompe l'oeil, and cellarium open to the public. Tranquil grounds bordering River Test boast many magnificent old trees and the formal walled garden, a home for historic shrub roses is particularly recommended for visually handicapped visitors. House and garden open to the public five days a week from April to end September. Local History Museum (not N.T.) in stable block. Occasional fetes champetres with fireworks, mummers, music etc are held; in 1985 open air events were two plays and a charity fair with silver band.
